When does this situation arise? And if the the subscription was not still pending, but we're in this catch block, isn't there still some error case?

For us to get here, we know that the subscription was added to the pendingSubscriptionIds set and we have a good connection. These two exceptions can happen either because of some malformed value passed into the put calls, or if createHeadersForSubscription throws an ApiException.
If the subscription was not pending, it's likely because cancel() was invoked some time after the connection was successfully established, but before the subscription handshake completed.
